questions.question: How many square miles does the park encompass?
questions.info: 1240 square miles burned in the fires of 1988-- which is just over 1/3 of the park.

questions.question: The 45th parallel is a geographic marker that passes through Yellowstone.  What position on the globe does it denote?
questions.info: Lake trout are extremely invasive and detrimental towards native fish populations. Lake trout can eat up to 41 cutthroat trout per year.
options: It's half way between the North Pole and the Equator.
It is the drainage divide where the water on each side drains into a different ocean.
It is 45 degrees from the prime meridian.

questions.question: Which of one of these is not a thermal feature?
questions.info: A geyser basin is a geographic area that has a cluster of hydrothermal features that include geysers, mudpots, hot springs and fumaroles.

questions.question: What percentage of the park is in Montana?
questions.info: 96% is in Wyoming, 3% in Montana and 1% in Idaho.

questions.question: The Yellowstone River is the longest undammed river in the lower 48 states. Its length, in miles, is:
The three tributaries of the Missouri River begin within, or just west of the Park.  Which of these rivers do not go on to form the Missouri:
Which animal has special joints that allow them to swing their legs over snow instead of having to push through it?
What year were wolves reintroduced in Yellowstone National Park?
questions.info: As of December 2016, there were at least 108 wolves in the park. Eleven packs were noted.

questions.question: Yellowstone is home to more than half of the world's active geysers, which number approximately:

Yellowstone is home to more than half of the world's active geysers, which number approximately:
Upon the creation of Yellowstone National Park, in 1872, which of these states were established?
What is North America's largest land animal?
questions.info: Bison are North America's largest land animals. Mature bulls weigh up to 2000 pounds. Bison can run at speeds approaching 35mph!

questions.question: Which of these is not a microorganism that contributes to the variety of colors seen in Yellowstone's hydrothermal features?
In 2016 which baby animal did tourists put in their car because, "It looked cold"?
About how many grizzly bears currently live in the Greater Yellowstone ecosystem?
questions.info: Grizzly bears may weigh up to 800lbs and consume up to 90lbs of food per day in the fall months.
